issues.description: The problem statement asks students to implement a custom toString() method that returns a String (task description and example show a String return). The solution implementation defines toString() with the signature 'public Object toString()' (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java lines 63-71). This changes the return type from String to Object and, combined with the @Override annotation, will cause a compile error (the method does not correctly override Object.toString() because of the wrong return type). This is a structural mismatch that would prevent students from compiling and running the example solution and contradicts the expected method signature in the exercise description and template TODO.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the toString() method in the solution to return a String to match the expected signature. For example: '@Override public String toString() { return "Lecture{" + ... + '}'; }'. Ensure the return type is String so the method properly overrides Object.toString() and compiles. Update any corresponding documentation/examples if needed.
